snippet: Unemployment claims dropped by 11,000 as the labor market continued to improve.
abstract: Labor Dept reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits fell to one of its lowest levels since before the 2007-9 recession, sign of increasing health in labor market; says initial claims dropped by 11,000, to seasonally adjusted 304,000 for week ending July 5, 2014.
lead_paragraph: Unemployment claims dropped by 11,000 as the labor market continued to improve.

headline.main: U.S. Jobless Claims Fall to Lowest Level Since Before Recession
headline.print_headline: Job Market Improvement Cuts Claims for Benefits
